items: Start by sitting or standing with your back straight and shoulders relaxed.
Extend your right arm in front of you, with your palm facing down.
Use your left hand to gently pull your right fingers back towards your wrist, until you feel a stretch in your forearm and fingers.
Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, then release.
Repeat the stretch with your left arm.
Next, extend both arms in front of you, with your palms facing down.

Use your left hand to gently pull your right fingers back towards your wrist, while simultaneously using your right hand to push your fingers forward, until you feel a stretch in your forearm and fingers.
Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, then release.
Repeat the stretch with your left hand pushing and right hand pulling.
Finally, shake out your hands and fingers to release any tension.
Improves flexibility and range of motion in fingers
Reduces stiffness and pain in fingers
Helps prevent hand and finger injuries
Increases blood flow and circulation in hands
Can be done anywhere, anytime, without equipment
